author: treeder
body:
I got this when I fired up Powershell today, "Couldn't compute FAST_CWD pointer". 

![cygwin-warning](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/75826/22186064/bfa8b8ee-e0a4-11e6-9587-f10007e91d97.PNG)

Any ideas?

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Unfortunately, this is showing up on `cmd` as well (many of across the team are hitting on it). Something going on with Windows. Given how many of use Git, I'm sure that someone is following up in Windows-land:

```
C:\dev\powershell>git pull
Cygwin WARNING:
  Couldn't compute FAST_CWD pointer.  This typically occurs if you're using
  an older Cygwin version on a newer Windows.  Please update to the latest
  available Cygwin version from https://cygwin.com/.  If the problem persists,
  please see https://cygwin.com/problems.html

Cygwin WARNING:
  Couldn't compute FAST_CWD pointer.  This typically occurs if you're using
  an older Cygwin version on a newer Windows.  Please update to the latest
  available Cygwin version from https://cygwin.com/.  If the problem persists,
  please see https://cygwin.com/problems.html

Cygwin WARNING:
  Couldn't compute FAST_CWD pointer.  This typically occurs if you're using
  an older Cygwin version on a newer Windows.  Please update to the latest
  available Cygwin version from https://cygwin.com/.  If the problem persists,
  please see https://cygwin.com/problems.html
```

comments.author: treeder
comments.body: I updated git to 2.11.0 and I think it may have resolved it. Was released 9 days ago.

title: Started getting some weird Cygwin warnings
